summary: How to choose a trustworthy seller, understand fees that change the final price, and when to consider transfer or refunds.

steps.heading: Where to buy (official channels)
steps.body:
Prefer official event/organiser/venue sites or primary ticketing partners.

Verify the domain (correct brand, HTTPS), company details, contacts & T&Cs.

Verified resale can be fine; classifieds/marketplaces are risky (duplicate PDFs, scams).

Be wary of too-cheap prices and payments outside the gateway.

steps.heading: Fees that change the final price
steps.body:
Base price + service fee + possible payment/delivery fees → watch the final amount.

Dynamic pricing is common for concerts.

Check currency / VAT / FX rate used.

Tip: Compare the final price, not the “from” price.

steps.heading: Transfers & refunds
steps.body:
Transfer = changing the ticket holder; check if allowed and the deadline.

Name on ticket may need to match an ID.

Refund policy: cancellation vs postponement (often no refund).

Consider insurance only if useful; chargeback is a last resort.

steps.heading: Pre-payment checklist
steps.body:
Clear seller identity, contacts, T&Cs, privacy.

3-D Secure card payment preferred.

Order summary (blocks/rows/seats, date, currency, all fees).

After purchase: confirmation email, add to Wallet / official app.

Red flags: WhatsApp-only, asking for ID photo, suspicious PDFs, fees >30%, no T&Cs or contacts.

ctaQuestion: Your trusted sellers or red flags to share? Tell us!
title: Where to buy safely
